stories.title: I have programmed a lot of interactive simulations and visualizations on (cont)

stories.text:
I'm not sure what term or phrase to search for, and that's really all I'm after here...

I'm thinking about spiking an idea/prototype for a system where you mount a microchip or other small tool on/in a wall in a grocery store, hospital, etc. and it broadcasts a simple UUID string on a radio frequency several hundred times per second continuously until it burns out or gets replaced. Max range only needs to be about ~50 feet, tops. What's the name of that kind of technology that I'd need to look up to learn more about it?

EDIT: Bluetooth occurs to me, but I'm thinking more low-level, fundamental than that, entirely without the need to receive (just broadcast only).
stories.title: Ask HN: What kind of chip for short-range continuous small-data broadcast?
What kinds of maps are Dungeon Masters searching for?
Big Data Infrastructure at the Crossroads
Trump's Social Media Site Quietly Admits It's Based on Mastodon
Show HN: Implementing a minimal Bitcoin-inspired block in Python

stories.text: I have a number of domain names I'm looking to dispose of.  Though I've been gradually allowing some to lapse at the end of their registry period, I suspect that others have some value.  I've sold a few domain names over the years, but am curious whether there are new platforms that provide better exposure or more-protection for both buyers and sellers beyond using an escrow service to manage the transfer.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the best platform for selling domain names?
Unlimited forwarding email addresses, snooze selected sender emails, once a week
